title: Anthony v Collins [2020] EWHC B15 (Costs)
summary: This case, Anthony v Collins, is about a detailed assessment of the costs claimed by the Claimant, Danny John Anthony, related to a contested will. The dispute centers on whether the costs claimed by the Claimant are in breach of the indemnity principle and whether sanctions should be imposed due to the manner in which the Claimant's case was presented.
participants: Contested Wills and Probate Lawyers Limited (Solicitors for the Claimant)
Mr Terence Johansson (principal of the solicitors)
Ms Larissa Wilson (solicitor responsible for dealing with the Claimant)

title: Deutsche Bank AG and Sebastian Holdings Inc & Alexander Vik [2020] EWHC B16 (Costs)
summary: The judgment primarily addressed three preliminary issues concerning the Claimant's bill of costs: the rate and period of interest on costs, the scope of the costs order, and the appropriate exchange rate for sums claimed in foreign currency. The court upheld the Judgments Act rate of 8% interest on costs, subject to certain deductions due to delays.
participants: The European Court of Human Rights

title: Fuseon Ltd, R (On the Application Of) v Shinners [2020] EWHC B18 (Costs)
summary: This case involved an appeal by Fuseon Limited regarding the detailed assessment of costs related to a private prosecution. The main costs issues revolved around the reasonableness of the costs claimed for prosecuting Timothy Shinners for fraud and theft. The initial assessment significantly reduced Fuseon's costs, citing disproportionate claims and the use of a London-based law firm rather than a local one.

title: James Nosworthy (as representative of the estate of Barbara Nosworthy (deceased)) v Royal Bournemouth & Christchurch Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust [2020] EWHC B19 (Costs)
summary: This case involved an application for interest on costs relating to a disbursement funded by a loan at 15% interest. The primary issue was whether the claimant was entitled to pre-judgment interest on the disbursement, which was incurred for an expert medical report. The claimant argued that the costs could not have been pursued without the loan, but the court ultimately refused the application.
participants: Royal Bournemouth & Christchurch Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Shulman v Kolomoisky & Anor [2020] EWHC B29 (Costs)
summary: This judgment dealt with determining the reasonable hourly rates to be allowed for the second defendant's legal representation. The second defendant instructed Skadden, Arps, Slate, Meagher & Flom LLP ("Skadden"), and there was a dispute regarding whether the rates charged were reasonable given their location in Canary Wharf, technically falling under the "Outer London" band.
participants: Skadden, Arps, Slate, Meagher & Flom LLP

title: Hassan Khan & Co & Anor v Al-Rawas & Anor [2020] EWHC B21 (Costs)
summary: This case revolved around the detailed assessment of costs after the Claimants served a bill totaling £305,275.64 for unpaid bills and orders. Key issues included the proper method for obtaining a Default Costs Certificate and whether the Defendants could actively participate in the detailed assessment without paying a portion of the costs.

title: Narayanasamy v Karim & Anor [2020] EWHC B22 (Costs)
summary: This case involved a detailed assessment application by the Claimant, who sought payment under a Conditional Fee Agreement (CFA) for legal services provided to the Defendants. The primary issue revolved around whether the Claimant's right to apply for assessment of his costs was statute-barred.

title: Utting v City College Norwich [2020] EWHC B20 (Costs)
summary: This case dealt with the issue of whether an "underspend" in budgeted costs constitutes a "good reason" to depart from a costs budget under CPR 3.18. The Claimant argued against reductions based on underspending, while the Defendant contended that any underspend warranted detailed assessment of those costs.
participants: Norfolk and Norwich University Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Iwuanyawu v Ratcliffes Solicitors [2020] EWHC B25 (Costs)
summary: Mrs. Iwuanyawu, the claimant, is seeking a detailed assessment of 13 out of 14 bills delivered to her by Ratcliffes Solicitors, the defendants, regarding her divorce proceedings. The defendants argued that the court lacked jurisdiction for some bills due to the time of payment.

title: Newman v Gordon Dadds LLP [2020] EWHC B23 (Costs)
summary: This legal case involves a billing dispute between Adam Newman (the claimant) and Gordon Dadds LLP (the defendant). The claimant argues that the defendant's recoverable fees should be limited to an initial estimate of £10,000.
